intro: Xysmalobium involucratum, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, elongated seed pods that release seeds upon maturity. Xysmalobium involucratum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
